abstract: Nonprofit International Service for Acquisition of Agri-Biotech Applications reports that farmers worldwide planted less acreage with genetically modified crops in 2015 than previous year, first such occurrence since 1996; drop off is largely attributed to lower commodity prices and corresponding decline in planting of crops generally, but data reveals market for genetically modified crops is saturated.

headline.print_headline: Planting of Genetically Modified Crops Declined in 2015
headline.main: Acreage for Genetically Modified Crops Declined in 2015

snippet: Efforts to expand use of biotechnology to crops other than corn, soybeans, cotton and canola have been hindered by opposition from consumer and environmental groups.
lead_paragraph: Efforts to expand use of biotechnology to crops other than corn, soybeans, cotton and canola have been hindered by opposition from consumer and environmental groups.
